gurmukhi: qIrQ kryn blBdR isDwXo ] nymKÍwrn BIqr AwXo ] Awie qhw nHwvn ien kXo ] icq ko Sok dUr kir dXo ]2382]
transliteration: Teerath Daren Balbhadra Sidhaayo|| Nemkhvaaran Bheetar Aayo|| Ooe Tahaa Nhaavan In Kayhit Ko Shok Door Kar(i) Dayo||2382||
translation: Balram reached for pilgrimage at Nemisharan; on coming there he took a bath and relinquished the sorrow of his mind.2382.

gurmukhi: rom hrKn Qo qhw soaU AwXo qh daur ] hlI mdrw pIq Qo kib sXwm qwhI Taur ]
transliteration: Rom Har Khan Tho Tahaa Thaur||
translation: Romharsh reached there running, where Balram was drinking wine;

gurmukhi: soaU Awie TwF BXo qhw jV Xwih isr n invwie kY ] blBdR kupXo kmwn kir lY mwirXo iqh Dwie kY ]2383]
transliteration: Sooo Ae Thaadh Tohaa Jad Yaah(i) Sir Na Nivaae Kai|| Balbhadra Koupyo Kamaan Kar(i) Lai Maariyo Tih Dhaae Kai||2383||
translation: On coming there, he stood there with bowed head and Balram coming speedily, taking his bow and arrows in his hands, in great rage, killed him.2383.

gurmukhi: sB irK auT TwFy qb Bey ] AwnMd ibsr ic`q ky gey ] iek irK Qo iqn AYs aucwrXo ] burw kIE hlDr idj mwrXo ]2384]
transliteration: Sabh Rikh Outh Thaadhe Tab Bhae|| Oonand Bisar Chitt Ke Gad|| Ik Rikh Tho Tin Ais Ouchdaryo|| Buraa Keeo Haldhar Dij Mdaryo||2384||
translation: Abandoning the peace of their mind, all the sages stood up and one of them said, “O Balram! you have performed a bad act in killing a Brahmin.”2384.

gurmukhi: qb hlDr pun AYs aucirXo ] bYT rihE ikau n hm qy firXo ] qb mY kRoD ic`q mY kIXo ] mwr kmwn sMg ieh dIXo ]2385]
transliteration: Tab Haldhar Poun Ais Ouchariyo|| Baith Rahio Kio Na Ham Te Dariyo|| Tab Mai Krodh Chitt Mai Keeyo|| Maar Kamaan San Eh Deeyo||2385||
translation: Then Balram said, “I was sitting here, why was he not frightned of me? Therefore, getting enraged, I killed him, by taking up my bow and arrows.2385.

gurmukhi: CqRI ko pUq Qo kop Bry iqh nws ikXo ibnqI suin lIjY ] TwF Bey auT kY irK so jV bYiT rihE kihE swc pqIjY ]
transliteration: Chhatriko Poot Kop Bhare Tih Naas Kiyo Bintisoun(i) Leejai|| Thaadh Bhae Outh Kai Rikh So Jad Baith(i) Rahio Kahio Saach Pateejai||
translation: “I was the son of a Kshatriya and was filled with ire, therefore I destroyed him;” Balram, making this request, stood up and said, “I am telling the truth that this fool sat uselessly near me;

gurmukhi: bwq vhY krIAY sMg C`qRn jwky kIey BIqr jIjY ] qwhI qy mY bDu qw ko kIXo su AbY morI BUl iCmwpn kIjY ]2386]
transliteration: Baat Vahaidareeai San Chhattran Jaake Keee Bheetar Jeejai|| Taahite Mai Badh(u) Taa Ko Keeyo Su Abai Moribhool Chhimaapan Keejai||2386||
translation: Only such a behaviour should be adopted with Kshatriyeas, so that may be able to live in the world; therefore I have killed him, but now forgive me for this lapse.”2386.
Speech of the sages addressed to Balram:

gurmukhi: imil sB irKn hlI so BwKI ] khY sXwm iqh idj kI swKI ] ieh bwlk Qwip ros ko hro ] bhuro jwie qIrQ sB kro ]2387]
transliteration: Mil(i) Sabh Rikhan Haliso Bhaakhee|| Kahai Syaam Tih Dij Kisaakhee|| Eh Baalak Thaap(i) Ros Kodaro|| Bahuro Jaae|| Teerath Sabhdaro||2387||
translation: All the sages, bearing testimony to the killing of the Brahmin, said to Balram, “O boy! now you removing all your anger, go to all the pilgrim-stations for a bath.”2387.
